articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Visit Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Visit Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and other senior party and state officials and officials of ministries and national institutions visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum Friday on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the war.
					 The visitors paid tribute to the statue of President Kim Il Sung waving back to the columns of the military parade for celebrating the victory in the war at the square.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the sculpture "Victory" in the Monument to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War and paid deep respects for the victors in the great annuals.
					
					 They looked round various halls of the museum which comprehensively deal with the exploits performed by the President in winning the victory in the war, the Songun revolutionary feats of leader Kim Jong Il and the heroic fighting spirit of the soldiers of the Korean People's Army and the Korean people and their feats.
					
					 They went round historic relics and mementoes including the car used by the President during the war, his personal letters, autographic orders and operational maps.
					
					 At the Hall "Victory of Songun Revolution" they keenly realized the devoted efforts made by Kim Jong Il for defending the sovereignty of the country and nation and laying an eternal foundation for the prosperity of the generations to come.
					
					 At various halls including large semi-panorama on the operation for the liberation of Soul, hall on the battle for Taejon, they looked round materials showing the noble spiritual world of the heroic soldiers who fought for the party, leader, country and its people at the risk of their lives.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Maldivian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Maldivian President
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Friday sent a message of greeting to Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom, president of the Republic of Maldives, on the occasion of its independence day.
					 The message sincerely wished the friendly Maldivian people progress and prosperity, believing that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and the Republic of Maldives would grow stronger.

articles.title: Congratulations to Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Malawi
articles.content:
Congratulations to Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Malawi
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Friday sent a congratulatory message to George Chaponda upon his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Malawi.
					 The message expressed expectation and belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the common interests and desire of the two peoples and wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Meeting of Road Administrators Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Road Administrators Held
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A meeting of road administrators took place Friday to bring about a revolutionary turn in the road administration of Pyongyang by giving full play to Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					 President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il consolidated the material and technical foundation in the field of road facilities and read a letter reflecting the determination of the road administrators.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un published famous works including "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation," indicating a specific orientation and ways for improving the road administration.
					
					 He acquainted himself with the admirable deeds being displayed among the road administrators in the capital and sent thanks to them for doing good things for years.
					
					 Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that the appearance of the roads in Pyongyang has undergone a dramatic change thanks to the ardent loyalty and warm patriotism of the  road administrators who have devoted themselves to the road administration for years whether they are known or unknown under the wise leadership and warm care of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They called for bringing about a turn in the road administration, true to the noble intention of Kim Jong Un, and making a positive contribution to sprucing up Pyongyang as a hub of Songun culture.
					
					 Present there Kim Su Gil, chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and road administrators in the city.
					
					 Earlier, there was an exhibition of facilities and equipment for road sanitation.

articles.title: Service Personnel Visit Revolutionary Site on Mt. Osong, Panmunjom
articles.content:
Service Personnel Visit Revolutionary Site on Mt. Osong, Panmunjom
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Service personnel of the Korean People's Army visited the Revolutionary Site of Mt. Osong.
					 They went round cliff on which leader Kim Jong Il pushed a jeep and climbed, observation post, etc.
					
					 Before the monument conveying the Songun leadership feats of the peerless great persons, they vowed to glorify forever the history and tradition of the arms of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Then they held a meeting to revenge the enemy and shooting contest.
					
					 Service personnel of the KPA visited Panmunjom.
					
					 They went round the monument inscribed with President Kim Il Sung's signature on the document conveying his feats for national reunification to posterity and Panmun Pavilion.
					
					 They held a meeting to renew their resolution in the hall where the armistice agreement was signed.
					
					 Om Hyang Chol, chairman of the KPA Committee of the youth league, said in his speech at the meeting:
					
					 The brigandish U.S. imperialists signed a document of surrender 61 years ago but they remain unchanged in their aggressive nature and ambition. This clearly proves that the KPA should settle accounts with the U.S. imperialists, the sworn enemy, with arms only.
					
					 Then followed narrative poem "Our War Victory Was Thus Won", chorus "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung", oratory "Our General and Panmunjom" and chorus "Revolutionary Armed Forces Uphold Leadership of Marshal Only".
					
					 Speakers expressed the will to wipe out all the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces bringing the dark clouds of war to this land through reckless nuclear threat and moves for aggression.

articles.title: Oratorical Meeting of Korean Youth and Students Held
articles.content:
Oratorical Meeting of Korean Youth and Students Held
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A national oratorical meeting of youth and students for celebrating the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War took place at the Central Youth Hall on Friday.
					 Present there were Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, officials of the youth league and youth and students in Pyongyang.
					
					 The meeting began with prologue "We Celebrate Victory".
					
					 The performers stressed that July 27 in Korea serves as a day of victory of the Juche-oriented military idea, strategies and tactics and outstanding commanding art of President Kim Il Sung and the victory of the army of Paektusan which leader Kim Jong Il glorified under the banner of Songun.
					
					 They said that July 27 of Songun Korea would last forever as it holds supreme leader Kim Jong Un in high esteem.
					
					 Kang Wi Song, student of Kim Il Sung University, in his oratory "Iron-willed Commander" said that the President is lauded by the peoples of the whole world as a peerless illustrious commander acclaimed by humankind.
					
					 Kim Chol U, student of Pyongyang University of Dramatic and Cinematic Arts, in his oratory "Great Years" praised the exploits performed by the brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu in winning the victory in the war, mesmerizing the audience.
					
					 So Un Ha, student of Central Cooking School, said  in her oratory "Flag" that flags of the children's union's camps would always vigorously flutter and cheerful laughter of the children would be heard everywhere under the loving care of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Ki Jong Hun, worker of the Railway Broadcasting Committee, said in his oratory "Our Supreme Commander" that the exploits Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed in winning the victory in  the war would always remain shining under the leadership of Kim Jong Un who has more strikingly demonstrated the national power of Songun Korea through his forced march of guerrilla style.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps Here
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps Here
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The floral basket and congratulatory letter were handed to General of the Korean People's Army Hyon Yong Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, on Friday by doyen of the corps Hassan Reza Husseini, military attache of the Iranian embassy here.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to Kim Jong Un
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from the family of Zhang Weihua, Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 It was handed to an official concerned on Friday.
					
					 He also received a floral basket from overseas Korean Jong Il Sim, widow of An Tong Su, Hero of the DPRK, on the same day.

articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Overseas Korean Jong Il Sim, widow of Hero of the DPRK An Tong Su, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Friday on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 She laid a floral basket before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Jonsung Revolutionary Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Jonsung Revolutionary Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- An endless stream of service personnel and people, school youth and children visited the Jonsung Revolutionary Site on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 At least 206,000 persons of over 1,720 organizations have visited the site in the past one year since the site was renovated.
					
					 In this historic place President Kim Il Sung led the war to victory, staying from January, Juche 40 (1951) to December, Juche 42 (1953).
					
					 There are the office of the President, a house where he guided the work of the military commission, a house where he examined and ratified the document of the armistice agreement, etc.
					
					 The visitors laid bouquets before the mosaic depicting the President and paid tribute to him.
					
					 Going round different places of the site, they deeply grasped the undying feats he performed by leading the war to victory and protecting the destiny of the country and the nation from the aggression of the imperialist allied forces.
					
					 They were moved to hear that he unrolled a far-reaching plan for postwar rehabilitation and construction, foreseeing the victory in the war even  under the hard conditions during the war decisive of life and death and he showed profound loving care for the people by making sure that the compulsory free medical care and other popular polices were enforced. 
					
					 Many overseas Koreans and foreigners also visited the historic site and highly praised the President as the outstanding strategist who recorded a brilliant chapter in the history of the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle.

articles.title: Gambian Vice-President Calls for Boosting Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Gambian Vice-President Calls for Boosting Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- It is the firm determination of the government of Gambia to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK in various fields, said Vice-President of Gambia Aja Isatou Njie Saidy after receiving the credentials from Hong Son Phyo, DPRK ambassador to Gambia, on July 15.
					 The vice-president said that he was grateful to HE Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people, for paying great attention to the development of the friendly relations between the two countries true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: DPRK's War Victory Brings about Beginning of Decline for U.S. Imperialism
articles.content:
DPRK's War Victory Brings about Beginning of Decline for U.S. Imperialism
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's victory in the 1950-1953 Korean War brought about the beginning of decline for the U.S., which boasted of its great military and economic potentials as well as of its history of 100-odd years of aggression.
					 The U.S. mobilized two million-strong forces in the war, along with latest weaponry. But its numerical and technical superiority over the Korean People's Army was overpowered by the superb stratagem and tactics of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 As for the U.S. defeat in the war, Western media ridiculed that the myth of U.S. invincibility was no more than a fiction.
					
					 After the war, the U.S. prestige in the world's arena began to sharply weaken.
					
					 National liberation and anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggles gained further momentum worldwide, fuelled by the Korean people's victory in the war. At least 50 nations had attained their independence from the imperialists' colonial rule until the late 1960s.
					
					 The Korean people's victory in the war signaled the advent of a new era of global independence.

articles.title: Victory Won by KPA in Three Days after Outbreak of Korean War
articles.content:
Victory Won by KPA in Three Days after Outbreak of Korean War
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- In the last Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953), the Korean People's Army liberated Seoul, the citadel of the enemy, in three days after its outbreak.
					 Such victory was ascribable to President Kim Il Sung's distinguished military wisdom.
					
					 On June 25, Juche 39 (1950) Kim Il Sung convened an extraordinary Cabinet meeting and issued an order to repulse the armed invaders' surprise attack and promptly launch an decisive counterattack.
					
					 Under his order, KPA combined units rushed into Miari Hill in north Seoul in the evening of July 27, annihilating the aggressors.
					
					 With his insight into the enemy's deployment of forces and strategic scheme, the President set forth an operational plan to encircle and wipe out them in the area of Seoul. And he gave an order to start the attack on Seoul at dawn of next day, anticipating that night attack might cause loss of civilians' lives and property and national cultural heritages.
					
					 After all, the KPA units' general attack was conducted on July 28 and the city of Seoul came under the control of the KPA side only in three days after the outbreak of the war.

articles.title: DPRK People Enjoy at Sanatoriums at Government Expense
articles.content:
DPRK People Enjoy at Sanatoriums at Government Expense
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- In the DPRK working citizens have enjoyed at sanatoriums across the country every year free of charge.
					 In this summer, those sanatoriums are very busy serving their visitors.
					
					 According to Ri Myong Ho, a department director of the Ministry of Public Health, the country has more than one hundred sanatoriums, all of which are located at sites rich in mineral springs.
					
					 The sanatoriums mainly serve balneation, fangotherapy and climatic treatments. There citizens take 30-day medical treatment at state expense. If necessary, they can take 45-day treatment with the days of regular leave involved.
					
					 In recent years, a number of dwelling houses have been built around sanatoriums for convenience of patients.

articles.title: Sports Enthusiasm Prevails in DPRK
articles.content:
Sports Enthusiasm Prevails in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Enthusiasm for sports prevails in the DPRK despite the lasting hot weather.
					 Sports facilities and parks in the capital city of Pyongyang and different parts of the country are crowed with visitors playing sports games of various events everyday.
					
					 In this regard, KCNA had interviews with some of them enjoying at sports establishments in Pyongyang, including the Rungna People's Sports Park.
					
					 Kim Kyong Nam, an official of the Taedonggang District Building Management Station, said:
					
					 "Taking exercises makes me feel as if I were ten years younger. And I feel stronger desire for work."
					
					 Sim Jung Hon, a 57-years old citizen in Jungsin-Dong, Sosong District, said at the Sanghung Children's Park:
					
					 "I would come here to watch sports games that always refresh my mind. Sometimes I feel desire to join those players."

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Should Mind Their Own Business before Slandering DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Should Mind Their Own Business before Slandering DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are groundlessly taking issue with tactical rocket firing and shelling drills of units of the Korean People's Army, terming them "threats" and "violation of resolutions", says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 Their talk about "provocations" and "threats" from someone is nothing but sheer sophism intended to evade the blame for bedeviling the inter-Korean relations and escalating tensions on the Korean peninsula, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is a trite method of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces to realize their ambition for aggression while making much ado about "provocations" and threats" from someone.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces which are deteriorating the inter-Korean relations and disturbing the peace and stability on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The above-said propaganda of the south Korean authorities is no more than a gangster-like logic making profound confusing of right and wrong.
					
					 The DPRK has made every possible effort to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve the reunification, peace and prosperity of the country.
					
					 What remains to be done by it is the final option and practical and all-out action.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should mind their own business before groundlessly slinging mud at the north.
					
					 If they truly want improved relations between the north and the south and peace on the Korean peninsula, they should make a switchover in their policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen to a policy of reconciliation through alliance with the north and make a policy decision to stop all joint military exercises for invading the north in league with foreign forces.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls on All to Display Same Spirit of Defending Country as Done in Wartime
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls on All to Display Same Spirit of Defending Country as Done in Wartime
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The spirit of defending the country displayed in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War serves as a very precious ideological and moral treasure for the army and people of the DPRK in their efforts to achieve the prosperity of the country and the victory in the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in an article.
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 "For the party and leader!" This was the core of the spirit of defending the country fully displayed by the army and people of the DPRK in the days of the war.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung represented the homeland, the mainstay and a symbol of victory for our army and people in the trying days of the war.
					
					 Thanks to the outstanding guidance of the party and leader the army and people had the firm faith that the country was sure to triumph in the war and the unshakable will to defend the Supreme Command at the cost of their lives and realize the operational plan and intention of the President. This was the noble spirit that burned their hearts.
					
					 The spirit for defending the country in the war was the spirit of waging a resolute anti-imperialist struggle which could be displayed only by the army and people of the DPRK as they regarded defending their ideology and social system at the cost of their lives as their bounden duty and conscience.
					
					 Dear native places, schools and work sites represented the true appearance of the country enshrined in the hearts of the brave fighters of the People's Army in the days of the war.
					
					 They dedicated their youth and lives without hesitation to the fight for wiping out the enemy forces as they could not allow those forces to deprive them of everything dear.
					
					 The said spirit serves as precious ideological and moral treasure of the Korean revolution and a source of invincible strength of Songun Korea dashing ahead like the wind towards the final victory.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. and S. Korean Authorities of Ridiculous Propaganda
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. and S. Korean Authorities of Ridiculous Propaganda 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean authorities asserted that the Korean war was a "victorious war" by origin, but it has been called "forgotten war." They are now busy describing the day of defeated war as the day of the "victorious war," claiming that now is the time to reassess it as the day of "forgotten victory". Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary terms this a burlesque arousing the derision of everybody.
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is only the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group in the world who are brazen-faced enough to paint the defeated war as the "victorious war".
					
					 Lurking behind their shameless propaganda is a cynical ploy to ignite the second Korean war at any cost in a bid to recover from their ignominious defeat.
					
					 But, this is nothing but a daydream.
					
					 Those who sustained the above-said defeat should bear this in mind.
					
					 The times have changed. The military muscle of the DPRK is incomparably stronger than what it used to be more than six decades ago.
					
					 The DPRK has the nuclear forces for self-defence powerful enough to break the U.S. nuclear stick at a single strike and the ever-victorious revolutionary armed forces of Mt. Paektu always ready to wipe out the enemy.
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet group dare ignite a new war, oblivious of the lesson drawn from the Korean war, the army and the people of the DPRK will wipe out the aggressors to the last man so that there might be no one left to sign a surrender document and accomplish the historic cause of the country's reunification.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers would be well advised to bear in mind the resolute declaration of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats for Victory in Fatherland Liberation War (2)
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats for Victory in Fatherland Liberation War (2)
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- During the Fatherland Liberation War (June 1950-July 1953), President Kim Il Sung foiled the U.S. forces' "General Christmas Offensive" with his unusual acumen.
					 It was one day in mid-November Juche 39 (1950) that Kim Il Sung told the commander of a combined unit of the Korean People's Army about an operational plan of the Supreme Command.
					
					 He confidently informed of the direction of main attack to be taken by the U.S. forces as well as their aim of attack. And he chose the western front as a direction of the KPA's main strike, telling about the counter-attack operational plan he had already mapped out. The commander was amazed at his intention because the western front was amassed with the main forces of the enemy.
					
					 Then he pointed to the date for launching a new operation, which was coincided with the start of the enemy's "General Christmas Offensive".
					
					 After all, the "general offensive" led to the enemy's all-out retreat.

articles.title: 100th-day Memorial Service for Victims of Ferry Sewol Disaster Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
100th-day Memorial Service for Victims of Ferry Sewol Disaster Held in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A memorial service took place at Seoul Square on Thursday 100 days since the ferry Sewol disaster, according to a south Korean media.
					 It was attended by members of the marchers group who covered more than 40 km from Tanwon District, Ansan City, Kyonggi Province on July 23 on the occasion of 100 days since the disaster and Seoul citizens, more than 30,000 in all.
					
					 At the memorial service speakers said they were struggling to let the people have the mandate to strictly investigate and probe the truth about the accident and punish those chiefly responsible for it.
					
					 They stressed that a special law should be instituted immediately to properly probe the truth into the disaster.
					
					 Then followed a recital of a memorial poem and performance.
					
					 The participants staged a demo toward Kwanghwamun plaza.
					
					 The police blocked the demonstrators, creating a terror-ridden atmosphere.

articles.title: March Starts in S. Korea to Probe Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster
articles.content:
March Starts in S. Korea to Probe Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Measure Committee of the Families of Victims, Missing Persons and Survivors of the Ferry Sewol Sinking Accident of south Korea on Wednesday started a march for having a special law instituted with the lapse of 100 days since the occurrence of the disaster, according to Yonhap News and Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 Participating in it were members of public organizations representing people from all walks of life and lawmakers from opposition parties.
					
					 The participants made public a kick-off declaration at the joint incense-burning alter in Tanwon District, Ansan City, Kyonggi Province.
					
					 The declaration said they started the march, unable to remain onlookers to the society where there is no opportunity of probing the truth about the disaster and a way is blocked for ensuring security.
					
					 It stressed that they would carry on the march till the special law is instituted to probe truth and guarantee security.
					
					 The participants kicked off their march to Seoul Square via Tanwon High School and the building of the "National Assembly" in Seoul.
					
					 They held that in order to clear the doubts of the people about the ferry Sewol sinking accident, it is necessary to hold a hearing and institute the special law.
					
					 Many passers-by encouraged the marchers, shouting that the bereaved families were just when they were demanding the clarification of the cause of the accident and build a safe society through the institution of the special law.

articles.title: Foot-and-Mouth Disease Occurs in S. Korea
articles.content:
Foot-and-Mouth Disease Occurs in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A foot-and-mouth disease occurred at a pig farm in Pian-myon, Uisong County, North Kyongsang Province of south Korea, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 The examination made of the blisters discovered from hundreds of pigs on Wednesday confirmed that they were foot-and-mouth disease.

articles.title: Korean in Japan Praises Exploits of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Korean in Japan Praises Exploits of Kim Il Sung 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was a brilliant military strategist and ever-victorious iron-willed commander who foiled all operations mapped out by strategists of the imperialist allied forces with desperate efforts and won the victory in the anti-imperialist revolutionary war.
					 O Hyong Jin, permanent advisor to the Research Institute on History of Korean Residents in Japan on a visit to the homeland, said this, expressing reverence for the President who demonstrated the spirit of heroic Korea before the whole world.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The three-year war was a criminal war ignited by the U.S. imperialists on the basis of the carefully arranged plan to stifle the DPRK by force of arms, put the whole of Korea under their control and, furthermore,  dominate Asia and other parts of the world.
					
					 In order to nip the DPRK in the bud, the U.S. imperialists mobilized huge armed forces and destructive weapons and employed all sorts of brutal methods and means.
					
					 The winner in the war was not the U.S. imperialists who boasted of their 100 odd year-long history of aggression but the just two year-old DPRK with a regular army. 
					
					 Thanks to the outstanding and experienced leadership of the President who proclaimed the great anti-Japanese war in his early years and led the bloody armed struggle to a victory, the DPRK compelled the U.S. imperialists to sign a document of surrender. As a result, fireworks were displayed to mark the victory in the war.
					
					 The U.S. should not forget the disgraceful history in which it suffered an ignominious defeat in the war in the  1950s.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un is leading the on-going confrontation with the U.S. as he is possessed of the spirit of attack originating from Mt. Paektu, distinguished commanding art, iron-willed courage and pluck.
					
					 The officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and Koreans in Japan will keep pace with the dynamic advance of the people in the homeland toward the final victory, single-mindedly united around Kim Jong Un, peerless great man.

articles.title: June 25-July 27 Month of Anti-U.S. Joint Struggle Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
June 25-July 27 Month of Anti-U.S. Joint Struggle Observed by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Special write-ups were posted on websites of various countries and a regional body in the period between June 30 and July 16 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of the anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 An article illustrated with a photo of leader Kim Jong Il inspecting a unit of the Korean People's Army was posted on the website of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany.
					
					 An article titled "Kim Jong Il, great master of Songun politics" praised him for turning the DPRK into an invincible military power by exerting primary efforts to bolster up the military muscle.
					
					 The website of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism noted in an article titled "Ignominious defeat of U.S.":
					
					 The heavy defeat suffered by the U.S. in the Korean war was the first of its kind in its history. It can neither be recovered nor written off no matter how much water may flow under the bridge. 
					
					 If the U.S. ignites a war again, oblivious of the lesson taught by the Korean war, it will not be the same ignominious defeat as what it sustained in the past but a complete ruin.
					
					 The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted on its website such articles as "July 27 of DPRK", "Meaning of Korean war".
					
					 Articles captioned "Truth behind outbreak of Korean war" and "Lesson taught by Korean war: power of U.S. is not almighty" were featured by the Russian internet magazines Mar 12 and Hanber Journal, the Russian internet TV Krasnoe Televidenie, websites of the Rostov Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia, the Kirov Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Crimean Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Group for Solidarity with DPRK, the Anti-"Globalization" Movement of Russia, Kim Jong Il Library of Ecuador, the Juche Youth Group in Ecuador and the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions.

articles.title: War Victory Day of Korean People Observed Abroad
articles.content:
War Victory Day of Korean People Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries between July 15 and 23 to mark the 61st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They included a meeting in Germany, Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition in Brazil, lecture, photo exhibition and film shows in Nigeria.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos showing the exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by leading the war to victory and the Songun exploits of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also displayed there were works of the peerless great men of Mt. Paetku, books and photos introducing Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with the creative skills of the Korean people.
					
					 Film shown included Korean film "Reply of Korea".
					
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany noted in a speech that Kim Il Sung protected the sovereignty, independence and peace of the DPRK and brought about the beginning of a downhill turn for the U.S. imperialists by achieving a brilliant victory in the Fatherland Liberation War 61 years ago.
					
					 The vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil lauded the exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and expressed support and solidarity for the service personnel and people of the DPRK in their just struggle to successfully carry forward the history and tradition of the victory in the war.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Songun Politics said in a lecture the miraculous victory achieved by the Korean people in the Korean war was a shining victory of the outstanding strategies and tactics, original war methods and superb commanding art of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory and other personages of Nigeria congratulated the Korean people on the 61st anniversary of their victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at an event held in Germany.

articles.title: Austrian Organization Blasts U.S.-S. Korea Joint Naval Drills
articles.content:
Austrian Organization Blasts U.S.-S. Korea Joint Naval Drills
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity Committee of Unionists for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in Austria on July 18 issued a statement condemning the U.S.-south Korea joint naval drills.
					 The statement strongly demanded the U.S. and the south Korean authorities stop the drills against the DPRK.
					
					 It said:
					
					 Huge armed forces of the U.S. and south Korea involved in these war maneuvers pose a serious threat to the peace and security of the region.
					
					 We urge the south Korean authorities to halt the military provocations against the fellow countrymen and come out to the negotiating table with the DPRK.
					
					 We denounce the anachronistic reckless acts of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: Cuadros visitan Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en Guerra
articles.content:
Cuadros visitan Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en Guerra
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 61o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado y los funcionarios de los ministerios y organos centrales visitaron el dia 25 el Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria. 
					Los participantes rindieron homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung ante su estatua de pie respondiendo con una mano alzada en la plaza del desfile militar por el triunfo en la guerra. 
					
					Luego, rindieron tributo a los triunfadores de la gran epoca tras colocar cestos de flores al pie de la escultura "Victoria" del Monumento a la Victoria en la Guerra.
					
					Ellos pasaron revista a varios salones que demuestran las proezas de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il realizadas por la victoria en la guerra y en la direccion sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun y el heroico espiritu de lucha y meritos de los militares y civiles. 
					
					Tambien vieron el carro usado por el Presidente en el periodo de la guerra, el mensaje personal, la orden escrita, el mapa operacional y otros datos y objetos  de interes historico-revolucionario. 
					
					En la sala de victoria en la revolucion del Songun ellos pudieron conocer mejor los esfuerzos mentales y fisicos del Dirigente quien defendio la soberania del pais y nacion y sento la eterna base para la prosperidad de generaciones venideras. 
					
					En la sala panoramica de la operacion de liberacion de Seul, la sala de Taejon y otras vieron los datos alusivos al noble mundo espiritual de los militares del tiempo de la guerra que dedicaron la juventud y la vida por el partido, el lider, la patria y el pueblo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Maldivas
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Maldivas
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 25 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de las Islas Maldivas, Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom, con motivo del dia de independencia de este pais.
					  El remitente expresa su conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran constantemente y desea de todo corazon al pueblo maldivo amistoso el progreso y la prosperidad.

articles.title: Efectuada reunion de cuidadores viales de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Efectuada reunion de cuidadores viales de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 25 la reunion de los cuidadores viales para registrar un cambio revolucionario en el cuido de las carreteras de la Ciudad de Pyongyang, poniendo de pleno manifiesto el patriotismo de Kim Jong Il.
					El Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il hicieron consolidar la base material y tecnica de la rama de instalaciones viales y tambien aceptaron las cartas de fidelidad de los cuidadores de carretera.
					
					En la obra "Para imprimir un nuevo viraje revolucionario a la administracion del territorio nacional conforme a la demanda de la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista" y otras el Mariscal Kim Jong Un indico el rumbo y remedios para mejorar y fortalecer el cuido vial.
					
					Tras averiguar en personal los datos alusivos a los trabajos ejemplares de los cuidadores viales de la capital, expreso el agradecimiento a ellos que cumplen mejor con su mision durante largo tiempo.
					
					En la ocasion presento el informe Cha Hui Rim, presidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang y hubo discursos.
					
					Los oradores mencionaron que fue renovado el aspecto de las carreteras de Pyongyang gracias a la fidelidad y el patriotismo de los cuidadores viales quienes dedican toda su vida para mantener y cuidar las carreteras bajo la profunda atencion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Y exhortaron a hacer gran aporte a transformar la Ciudad de Pyongyang en el centro de la cultura de Songun, al guardar en lo profundo de corazon el noble proposito del Mariscal y lograr un cambio en el cuido vial.
					
					En la reunion estuvieron presentes el secretario responsable del Comite del Partido en la ciudad de Pyongyang, los funcionarios de la rama interesada y los cuidadores viales de esta capital.
					
					Antes del inicio de la reunion, tuvo lugar la exhibicion de los equipos y aparatos para cuidar las carreteras.

articles.title: Tiene lugar oratoria de jovenes y estudiantes
articles.content:
Tiene lugar oratoria de jovenes y estudiantes 
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar en la Casa Central de la Juventud la oratoria nacional de los jovenes y estudiantes en celebracion del 61o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria. 
					Participaron el presidente del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, Jon Yong Nam, y otros funcionarios de la UJS, jovenes y estudiante en esta capital. 
					
					En el acto iniciado con la poesia de prologo "Celebramos la victoria" los ejecutantes destacaron que la victoria en la pasada guerra coreana es el triunfo de la autoctona idea militar, estrategia y tacticas y probado arte de mando militar del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung y de las fuerzas armadas del monte Paektu consolidadas por el Generalisimo Kim Jong Il bajo la bandera del Songun. 
					
					Enfatizaron que gracias al Mariscal Kim Jong Un, otro general insigne del Songun, sera eterno el 27 de julio de la Corea del Songun. 
					
					El estudiante de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, Kang Wi Song, en su oratoria "Comandante de Acero" dijo que el Presidente Kim Il Sung es elogiado por todo el mundo como general no visto en la historia. 
					
					El estudiante del Instituto Superior de Arte Dramatico y Cinematografico de Pyongyang, Kim Chol U conmovio mucho a los participantes con su oratoria "Gran decada" que alaba las proezas del General Insigne del monte Paektu por la victoria en la guerra. 
					
					La estudiante de la Escuela Central de Cocineros, So Un Ha, en su oratoria "Bandera" afirmo que gracias al Mariscal Kim Jong Un, se flameara siempre en el cielo de la patria la bandera del campismo infantil y resonaran las risas de los ninos. 
					
					El obrero del Comite de Radio del Ferrocarril, Ki Jong Hun, en su oratoria "Nuestro Comandante Supremo", apunto que gracias al Mariscal Kim Jong Un, quien exalta el poderio de la Corea del Songun con la marcha forzada al estilo de la guerrilla, seran eternas las proezas de los Generalisimos por la victoria en la guerra antiyanqui.
